name: CuraDynamicObservation
description: An observation documented on a citizen.

element.definition: An observation documented on a citizen.

element.name: Observation.extension-de4d8dba
element.short: Contains information about the last user that marked the observation as unfinished
element.definition: Contains information about the last user that marked the observation as unfinished

element.name: Observation.extension-97f61acc
element.short: This instruction will contain a link and a title for an instruction for a dynamic observation.
element.definition: This instruction will contain a link and a title for an instruction for a dynamic observation.

element.name: Observation.extension-a4608460
element.short: Context in which the observation exists, e.g. casework/request task
element.definition: Context in which the observation exists, e.g. casework/request task

element.name: Observation.extension-76fc5a9b
element.short: Contains information about all user roles for which this observation is relevant.
element.definition: Contains information about all user roles for which this observation is relevant.

element.name: Observation.extension-b8db6402
element.short: Contains information about which conditions this observation is relevant for.
element.definition: Contains information about which conditions this observation is relevant for.

element.name: Observation.extension-a2812cf7
element.short: Linked VUM themes. Should contain only level 2 codings from FFBCondition-classification
element.definition: Linked VUM themes. Should contain only level 2 codings from FFBCondition-classification

element.name: Observation.extension-17a3817b
element.short: Linked VUM sub-themes. Should contain only level 3 codings from FFBCondition-classification
element.definition: Linked VUM sub-themes. Should contain only level 3 codings from FFBCondition-classification

element.name: Observation.extension-e2351834
element.short: The type of observation, e.g. clinical or case observation
element.definition: The type of observation, e.g. clinical or case observation

element.name: Observation.extension-e71835d4
element.short: Whether the observation default leaves a task
element.definition: Whether the observation default leaves a task

element.name: Observation.extension-83b779c8
element.short: Whether multiple tasks may be added for this observation type
element.definition: Whether multiple tasks may be added for this observation type

element.name: Observation.extension-8257281c
element.short: Whether the observation is stepwise documented
element.definition: Whether the observation is stepwise documented

element.name: Observation.extension-96c7c7cb
element.short: Whether there is a previous step in the documentation
element.definition: Whether there is a previous step in the documentation

element.name: Observation.extension-e91e2671
element.short: Next step in the documentation
element.definition: Next step in the documentation

element.name: Observation.extension-543f0a0e
element.short: Whether observation should be visible in Cura Dialog
element.definition: Whether observation should be visible in Cura Dialog

element.name: Observation.extension-992ab1a8
element.short: The calculation values of the items selected in the selection lists.
element.definition: The calculation values of the items selected in the selection lists.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: id
element.definition: A unique identifier for the simple observation instance.

element.short: status
element.definition: The status of the result value

element.short: class
element.definition: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.  This is used  for searching, sorting and display purposes.

element.short: what
element.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name"

element.short: who.focus
element.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation and into whose record the observation is placed.  Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, donor,  other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject.

element.short: context
element.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made

element.short: when.done
element.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

element.short: when.recorded
element.definition: The date and time this observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

element.short: who.actor
element.definition: Who was responsible for creating observation

element.short: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value
element.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value

element.short: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
element.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

element.short: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.  Intended as a simple compact code often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result. Otherwise known as abnormal flag.
element.definition: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.  Intended as a simple compact code often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result. Otherwise known as abnormal flag.

element.short: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.
element.definition: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.

element.short: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).
element.definition: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

element.short: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation
element.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation

element.short: The specimen that was used when this observation was made
element.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made

element.short: The device used to generate the observation data.
element.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.

element.name: ReferenceRange
element.short: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range
element.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range

element.short: The value of the low bound of the reference range.  The low bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9).   If the low bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is <=2.3).
element.definition: The value of the low bound of the reference range.  The low bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9).   If the low bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is <=2.3).

element.short: The value of the high bound of the reference range.  The high bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9).   If the high bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is >= 2.3).
element.definition: The value of the high bound of the reference range.  The high bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9).   If the high bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is >= 2.3).

element.short: Code for the meaning of the reference range
element.definition: Code for the meaning of the reference range

element.short: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so
element.definition: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so

element.short: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation.  An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of 'normals'.
element.definition: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation.  An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of 'normals'.

element.name: Related
element.short: A  reference to another resource (usually another Observation but could  also be a QuestionnaireAnswer) whose relationship is defined by the relationship type code.
element.definition: A  reference to another resource (usually another Observation but could  also be a QuestionnaireAnswer) whose relationship is defined by the relationship type code.

element.short: A code specifying the kind of relationship that exists with the target resource
element.definition: A code specifying the kind of relationship that exists with the target resource

element.short: A reference to the observation or [[[QuestionnaireResponse]]] resource that is related to this observation
element.definition: A reference to the observation or [[[QuestionnaireResponse]]] resource that is related to this observation

element.name: Component
element.short: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.
element.definition: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

element.short: what
element.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "code"

element.short: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value
element.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value

element.short: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
element.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

element.short: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range
element.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range
